title: Harry Kane sends message to Spurs teammates after Red Star thrashing
text:
Harry Kane scored twice as Spurs thrashed Red Star in the Champions League (Picture: Getty)

Harry Kane has urged his Tottenham teammates not to get carried away following their convincing 5-0 victory over Red Star in the Champions League on Tuesday night.

The pressure was on Spurs ahead of the game following a run of just one win in their last seven matches in all competitions but the players delivered a morale-boosting display against the Serbian champions.

Kane had been without a goal in two club games but he opened and finished the scoring with two well-taken finishes, while Heung-Min Son also helped himself to a double and Erik Lamela found himself on the scoresheet in his 200th Spurs game.

Kane opened the scoring for Spurs against Red Star (Picture: Getty)

Attention now turns to Spurs’ trip to Anfield on Sunday where they face league leaders Liverpool and Kane is hopeful that the team can carry momentum from their thrashing of Red Star into this weekend’s fixture.

‘It all depends on how we carry it on, it is one win, one result,’ he said post-match. ‘Like I said, at home we were expected to win this game so we can’t get too carried away with it. We have to stay focused and take the positives and take them into the Premier League.

‘It is exactly what we needed, a great performance, a lot of energy, plenty of goals, a clean sheet – a perfect night. But it doesn’t stop here, it was a game we were expected to win. We have got a very tough game on Sunday so I hope we can take momentum into that.’

It was an excellent performance from Spurs and a much-needed three points in the Champions League following a slow start to the campaign but they will face a far sterner test against Liverpool at the weekend given their form.

Kane acknowledged that Spurs face a tough game on Sunday but has challenged his team to start making up ground in the Premier League table after taking only four points from a possible 12 in their last four games.

He added: ‘It is always better when you are coming off a win rather than a loss or a draw. But of course, we know in the Premier League we are far behind and have a lot of catching up to do.

‘Sunday will be a tough game. They have started the season very well so we have to make sure we put in a performance similar to Tuesday.’
description: Harry Kane has urged his Spurs teammates not to get carried away following their 5-0 win over Red Star in the Champions League on Tuesday.
